content: I highly recommend Blue Bottle Coffee on Market Street. Great atmosphere, reliable WiFi, and their single-origin pour-overs are excellent. Usually not too crowded during weekday mornings.
Philz Coffee is another great option! They have multiple locations downtown and the custom blends are amazing. The one on Folsom has plenty of seating and good WiFi.
Try Sightglass Coffee if you want something a bit more upscale. Their espresso is top-notch and the space is perfect for getting work done.
Yes! The farmers market is still happening every Saturday from 8 AM to 2 PM in the town square. They have a great selection of local produce and artisanal goods.
I was there last Saturday and it was packed! Get there early for the best selection. The Baker's Dozen booth usually sells out of their sourdough by 11 AM.
I used Martinez Plumbing last month and they were fantastic. Fair prices, showed up on time, and explained everything they were doing. Highly recommend! Their number is (415) 555-0123.
Try Bay Area Home Services. They fixed my kitchen sink last year and did great work. A bit pricier but very thorough and professional.
It's going to be Nonna's Kitchen - an authentic Italian restaurant! The owner used to work at Chez Panisse. They're aiming to open next month. Can't wait!
Start with the Bear Creek Trail - it's only 3 miles roundtrip with beautiful lake views. Very well-maintained and not too steep. Perfect for beginners!
I'd also recommend the Meadow Loop Trail. It's flat, easy, and you might see some wildlife. Great for building up your hiking confidence.
Same here! Power's been out since around 7 PM. I called the utility company and they said they're working on it. Estimated restoration time is 11 PM.
